title.rendered: The Secrets Of Activating Your Longevity Switches

content.rendered:
What’s the point in living a long time? Being fully in contribution to life. I want to do that feeling healthy and vital, not sick and decrepit. 

Everything we do speaks to our genes—the food we eat, our relationships, our environment. You’re either telling your genes to age faster or age slower. So I’m constantly working on how to give my genes the right information to do the latter. 

Today’s podcast episode was recorded on my recent trip to Antarctica with my own doctor, Dr. Matt Cook. He’s helped me heal and has integrated so many different forms of technologies and science to rebuild people’s health from the ground up. 

Throughout this episode, we explore some of the most profound breakthroughs in understanding human biology and how to reduce the symptoms of aging. The nutritional part is multidimensional—it’s about getting the right nutrients in, getting the toxic ingredients out, and then reaping the benefits of other components like fiber, probiotics, and phytochemicals. Supplements can be a helpful complement to a wholesome diet, which Dr. Cook and I elaborate on as well.

We explain the concepts of oxidative stress, inflammation, mitochondria, mTOR, and so much more. All of us have longevity switches built into our bodies, we just have to use the right inputs to turn them on.

Dr. Cook joins me in breaking down these areas of longevity and we talk about the regenerative medicine therapies and protocols that we’ve both had success with. Things like stem cells, exosomes, nutrient IVs, hyperbaric oxygen, and beyond. 

Hormetic stressors cause just enough stress on the body to elicit healing actions without causing harm. Dr. Cook and I discuss how we can use therapies like these, which include cold therapy, ozone, and others, to maximize healing and reverse aging.

It’s amazing what we can do to feel better at any age. Whether you want to do things from home like making diet or lifestyle changes or jump into more advanced therapies with a regenerative medicine doctor, this is a great episode to learn from and create your own healthy-aging plan.
